Description:
Background
Teachers report frequent friction during sign‑in: low‑contrast labels, unclear errors, and inconsistent behavior on mobile devices. Help desk tickets cite forgotten passwords, lockouts after failed attempts, and confusion about which account to use. This epic addresses those problems end‑to‑end to make login fast, forgiving, and inclusive.

What needs to be done
We will redesign the login flow with clear labels and input states, add a password visibility toggle, provide better validation and guidance, improve error messages, add caps‑lock detection, clarify session options, and harden the “forgot password” flow with intuitive copy. Rate limiting and lockout rules will be tuned and communicated clearly. We will also add resilient loading states and prevent accidental double‑submissions.

Why it needs to be done
Friction at login blocks class time and generates support volume. A simpler login cuts failure loops and reduces average time-to-first-action. The work unlocks downstream flows (roster sync, assessments) by getting teachers reliably into the product.

Acceptance criteria
• Teachers can complete sign‑in without confusion from common error cases (bad password, invalid email, caps lock on, network error).
• Helpful, plain‑language error messages with steps to resolve are shown inline and in banners where appropriate.
• Inputs validate early (email format) and guide users before submission.
• Buttons indicate loading state and block duplicate submissions.
• Password toggle is present and accessible via keyboard/tap.
• Lockouts are communicated with time remaining and next steps.
• “Forgot password” is discoverable and results in a clear success message and guidance if no account is found.

Success KPI
A critical KPI is a measurable reduction in customer support tickets related to teacher sign‑in after release (target −40% within 60 days). Secondary signals include improved first‑attempt success rate and reduced time to sign‑in.

As a teacher, I am confused when my password is wrong and need a clear message that explains what failed and how to fix it.
Acceptance Criteria:
- When credentials are incorrect, show a banner: “That password doesn’t match this account.”
- Provide inline help with a “Reset password” link and “Check caps lock” hint.
- Focus moves to the password field; screen readers announce the error.
- No security leakage (do not confirm whether the email exists).

Summary: Improve reliability and clarity of activation link delivery
Description:
As a teacher, I want activation emails to arrive quickly and include clear steps so I can activate my account. Acceptance Criteria:
- Activation email sent immediately upon signup.
- Include expiry info and support contact.
- Retry option if email not received within 5 minutes.

Summary: Remember me copy and session clarity
Description:
As a teacher, I want to understand what “Remember me” does so I can decide confidently.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Tooltip or helper text explains session duration and device scope.
- Default is unchecked.
- No change to security posture; follows org policy.

As a teacher, I want to know if my email is invalid before I submit so I can correct it quickly.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Email field validates on blur and submit.
- Invalid format shows inline error and prevents submit.
- Example format hint appears under field (e.g., name@school.edu).

Summary: Improve Forgot Password discoverability and flow
Description:
As a teacher, I want a clear path to reset my password and confirmation that it worked.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Prominent “Forgot password?” link near password field.
- After request: show success banner regardless of account existence.
- If email not found, provide next-step guidance without account enumeration.

Summary: Fix account verification and confirmation messages
Description:
As a teacher, I want to understand my account verification state so I know whether I can sign in. Acceptance Criteria:
- Show clear verified/unverified banner.
- Allow resending verification link.
- Expired links display guidance to request a new one.

As a teacher on mobile, I want the email keyboard and proper auto-capitalization so typing is easier.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Email field uses email keyboard; disables auto-capitalization.
- Password field disables autocorrect and suggestions.
- Tap targets meet comfortable size; viewport avoids input jump.

As a teacher, I want the Sign In button to show it’s working and not submit twice so I don’t get duplicate errors.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Submit shows spinner and disables the form until a response.
- Hitting Enter again while loading does nothing.
- Timeout after 15s shows a retriable network message.

As a teacher, I want to be warned if Caps Lock is on so I avoid password mistakes.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Caps Lock indicator appears when typing in password if active.
- Message is subtle but visible; announced for assistive tech.
- No telemetry of actual password content.

Summary: Enable account merge for duplicate teacher profiles
Description:
As a teacher, I want to merge duplicate accounts so my data is consolidated under one login. Acceptance Criteria:
- Merge flow verifies ownership via email.
- Display data migration summary before confirmation.
- Keep both old and new credentials valid until merge completes.

- Send email confirmation after deletion.

As a teacher, I want to reveal my password briefly so I can avoid typos on small keyboards.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Eye icon toggles masked/unmasked state.
- Toggle is keyboard/touch accessible and announces state change.
- Default remains masked; state resets after submit.

As a teacher, I need guidance if my email isn’t recognized so I know how to proceed without exposing account existence.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Show generic success message after reset request.
- Provide guidance to contact school admin or try another email.
- Logging records “email not found” without surfacing to user.

As a teacher, I want clear guidance if I’m offline or the network fails so I can retry effectively.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Distinguish offline vs server error with specific copy.
- Provide Retry button; auto-retry on reconnect.
- Preserve typed inputs across retries.

As a teacher, after resetting my password I want to return to the login screen with a clear success message.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Deep link back to login with “Password reset email sent” confirmation.
- Inputs prefill email field when returning from reset.
- No auto-fill of password fields.
